title: SAT100 Unit 1 Current Non Sustainable Agriculture Practices

tasks.task: Preparing soil for planting in non-sustainable agriculture practices.
subtasks: Observing traditional plowing methods for land preparation.
Understanding the impact of tilling on soil erosion and wind erosion.
Implementing conservation practices to reduce soil loss.
Evaluating the effectiveness of cultivation techniques in weed control.
Analyzing the transition from plowing to no-till farming methods.

tasks.task: Addressing synthetic fertilizer reliance in agriculture.
subtasks: Recognizing the historical development and widespread use of synthetic fertilizers.
Examining the environmental drawbacks of synthetic nitrogen fertilizer application.
Investigating nutrient leaching and its effects on waterways.
Considering the long-term impact of nitrogen runoff on soil vitality and marine ecosystems.

tasks.task: Evaluating pest and weed control strategies in present agriculture.
subtasks: Reviewing the evolution of chemical herbicides, pesticides, and fungicides.
Assessing the diminishing effectiveness of synthetic chemicals over time.
Considering the ecological consequences of synthetic pest control agents.

tasks.task: Discussing the shift from small-scale farming to corporate agriculture.
subtasks: Tracing the decline of family-owned farms and the rise of corporate farming.
Analyzing the impacts of large-scale animal feedlots on pollution and disease prevalence.
Evaluating the trade-offs between cost-efficiency and environmental sustainability in corporate farming practices.

tasks.task: Identifying the limitations of current agricultural practices.
subtasks: Highlighting declining soil fertility and the challenges of monoculture farming.
Addressing water resource depletion and the salinization of irrigated soils.
Exploring the interconnected issues of fertilizer, pesticide runoff, and oceanic ecosystem decline.
